snippet: Many investors are trying to figure out how to generate income in a time of low interest rates. Some Duke undergraduates think they have the answer.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column on a possible solution by some students in Duke University's undergraduate economics department that may help investors who are trying to figure out how to generate income in a time of low interest rates; cites student competition to design proper asset allocation among stocks, bonds, fixed income and other investments.
lead_paragraph: Many investors are trying to figure out how to generate income in a time of low interest rates. Some Duke undergraduates think they have the answer.

headline.print_headline: Conceived By Students, A Portfolio That Pays
headline.seo: A Prize-Winning Plan for Investing When Interest Rates Are Low
headline.main: Conceived by Students, a Portfolio That Pays
